text.text: How can I configure ZOLL Billing to generate claims from ePCRs received from different sources?

text: To configure ZOLL Billing to generate claims from ePCRs received from different sources, you can use the Billing API. The API comes standard on each ZOLL Billing product. You can gather the following information to give to your ePCR agency: Your account ID, which is the value used for your organization (your ZOLL Online Account ID).

text.text: What information do I need to gather to provide to my ePCR agency for configuring the Billing API?

text: To configure the Billing API, you need to gather the following information to provide to your ePCR agency: Your account ID, which is the value used for your organization (your ZOLL Online Account ID). You also need to gather the following information: Username, which is the API username/key. You also need to gather the following information: Password, which is the API key password.

text.text: How can I find my Company account ID in ZOLL Online?

text:
To find your Company account ID in ZOLL Online, you can:

* Hover over Company on the navigation bar.
* Click My Account and then My Profile.

text.text: In an MCM environment, where can I find the Account ID for child companies?

text: If you are in an MCM environment and are in a child company, hovering over Company on the navigation bar will only show you the Account ID of the parent company. You can call Support to get the Account ID of the child companies. If you are in Implementation, you can obtain the Account IDs of your child companies from your account manager.

text.text: What is the purpose of the XML snippet provided for the Billing API configuration?

text: The XML snippet provided for the Billing API configuration is used to submit data to the ZOLL Online NEMSIS V3 Service. The snippet includes the following information: username, password, organization, requestType, and submitPayload.

text.text: Where can I find the URL for submitting data requests via the Billing API?

text: The URL for submitting data requests via the Billing API is https://boundarysvc.zollonline.com/NEMSISWebService/NEMSISV3Service.svc.

text.text: What permissions do I need in ZOLL Billing to generate API credentials?

text: To generate API credentials, you need to be a Company Administrator in ZOLL Billing. You also need to have the following permissions: Edit API credentials, View API credentials, NEMSIS import roles & permissions.

text.text: How can I grant user permissions to create API credentials in ZOLL Billing?

text: To grant user permissions to create API credentials in ZOLL Billing, you need to log onto ZOLL Online and go to Admin > Billing > User Accounts. Then, you need to go to the Administration roles & permissions banner and check the box next to Edit API credentials and View API credentials. You also need to scroll down and find the NEMSIS import roles & permissions banner. Finally, you need to change the product access from no to yes.

text.text: What steps do I need to follow to grant a user the necessary permissions for API credential administration?

text: To grant a user the necessary permissions for API credential administration, you need to log onto ZOLL Online and go to Admin > Billing > User Accounts. Then, you need to go to the Administration roles & permissions banner and check the box next to Edit API credentials and View API credentials. You also need to scroll down and find the NEMSIS import roles & permissions banner. Finally, you need to change the product access from no to yes.

text.text: Where can I find the option to create API credentials in ZOLL Billing?

text: To create API credentials, you need to go to Admin > NEMSIS Import > API Credentials.

text.text: What precautions should I take after generating API credentials, especially regarding the password?

text: You can see the key later on but you won't see the password again so it is very important to note the password. You can enable, disable, and delete a key. Clicking a link for an existing key will display the key again but not the password for the key. You can create multiple keys.

text.text: Can I create multiple API credentials for different ePCR vendors?

text: Yes, you can create multiple API credentials for different ePCR vendors.

text.text: How can I enable, disable, or delete a key for API credentials in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can enable, disable, or delete a key for API credentials in ZOLL Billing. You can also create multiple keys.

text.text: If I forget the password for an API credential, how can I retrieve it?

text: You can't retrieve a password for an API credential.

text.text: Can I view the password again after generating API credentials in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can't view the password again after generating API credentials in ZOLL Billing.

text.text: What actions are available when clicking on an existing key for API credentials?

text: When clicking on an existing key for API credentials, you can display the key again but not the password for the key.

text.text: Is there a limit to the number of API credentials I can create in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can create multiple keys.

text.text: Can I share API credentials between multiple users in ZOLL Billing?

text: Not everyone can generate API credentials. You must be a Company Administrator in ZOLL Billing to have the correct permissions enabled.

text.text: How can I ensure the security of API credentials in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To ensure the security of API credentials in ZOLL Billing, you should:

* Only share API credentials with trusted users.
* Keep API credentials in a secure location.
* Change the password for API credentials regularly.
* Disable API credentials when they are not in use.
* Delete API credentials when they are no longer needed.

text.text: Are there any additional considerations or best practices to follow when using API credentials for ePCR integration with ZOLL Billing?

text: If you have multiple ePCR vendors, each vendor will need their own key/password combination.

text.text: what information are required to to give to the ePCR agency?

text: You will need to gather the following information to give to your ePCR agency: * Your account ID: The Company account ID is the value used for your organization (your ZOLL Online Account ID). It is easy to find your account ID, just hover over 'Company' on the ZOLL Online navigation bar.

text.text: what are the steps to grant user permission to create key ?

text: To grant user permission to create key, you must first give permissions to the user that will be administering the credential. The user must be a Company Administrator in ZOLL Billing. To do this, you must log onto ZOLL Online and go to Admin > Billing > User Accounts. Then, you must go to the Administration roles & permissions banner and check the box next to Edit API credentials and View API credentials. You must also scroll down and find the NEMSIS import roles & permissions banner. Change the product access from no to yes.

text.text: how to set credential for api management

text: To set credential for api management, you must first give permissions to the user that will be administering the credential. The user must be a Company Administrator in ZOLL Billing.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=jwhldkuzpo

text.text: how to configure user for api key management?

text: To configure user for api key management, you must first give permissions to the user that will be administering the credential. The user must be a Company Administrator in ZOLL Billing.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=jwhldkuzpo

text.text: how to manage NEMSIS API credential?

text: To manage NEMSIS API credential, you must go to Admin > NEMSIS Import > API Credentials.

text.text: how do i create and manage nemsis api credential?

text: To create and manage NEMSIS API credential, you must go to Admin > NEMSIS Import > API Credentials. If you have multiple ePCR vendors, each vendor will need their own key/password combination.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=6warwewmsa
